I do not have personal preferences or favorites among the resources i recommended, as i do not have emotions or personal beliefs. however, i can provide you with an overview of each resource to help you decide which one may be most interesting or relevant to you. here is a brief summary of each resource mentioned:

1. "the gospel of sri ramakrishna" by swami nikhilananda - this is a highly regarded work that is considered a primary source on ramakrishna's life and teachings. it is a comprehensive account that covers many aspects of ramakrishna's spiritual journey and his teachings on karma, devotion, and other key topics. 2. "ramakrishna and his disciples" by christopher isherwood - this book is a personal account of the author's interactions with the ramakrishna order and his experiences with ramakrishna's disciples. it provides insights into the daily life and practices of the order in the mid-20th century. 3. "ramakrishna and vivekananda: new perspectives" edited by shalini advani - this collection of essays provides a modern perspective on ramakrishna's teachings and their relevance today. it covers a range of topics, including ramakrishna's approach to spirituality, his relationship with vivekananda, and his teachings on social justice. 4. "introduction to vedanta" by swami dayananda - this book is an introduction to the philosophical system of vedanta. it covers the key concepts and principles that underlie many of ramakrishna's teachings, such as the nature of the self, the relationship between the individual and the divine, and the concept of karma. i hope this helps you decide which resource may be most interesting and useful to you!
